Purpose of the Job – Why does the job exist and what is it designed to accomplish?
The Commercial Manager services and expands existing relationships with customers of platinum group metals (PGM) markets in EMEA through a regular, organized marketing program. The position is responsible for soliciting new, large commercial/industrial accounts that meet the business unit's credit and profitability criteria. The goal of the job is to be instrumental in expanding the company's market share of the PGM business in EMEA.
Keep abreast of all major changes influencing precious metals business environment.
Ensure alignment with CC-EM/R, CC-EE, Hydrogen business and CCP/BASFand supports those businesses in the PGM area

Knowledge and Experience – What skills, training or experience are needed to perform the job?
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related discipline.
5 years of progressive experience in a commodities trading environment.
3 years of experience on a precious metals trading desk, with most of that time having been spent in the PGM area preferred.
Demonstrated strong understanding of global financial markets
Experience in marketing and commercial activities.
Developed proficiency in the following BASF competencies must be evident and demonstrated:
Entrepreneurial Thinking
Strategic Thinking
Communication and Interpersonal Understanding
Customer Focus
Principal Responsibilities – Brief statements indicating what is done (Action), how it is done (Method or Means) and why (End Result). (Use additional sheet of paper if necessary.)
Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Customer service
Answering customer queries where possible. Regularly visits on existing customers with a view to discovering new aspects of their precious metals requirements, which we can profitably meet.
Work closely with traders in quoting and hedging precious metals deals.
Regularly call on potential customers with a view to discovering new aspects of their precious metals requirements, which we can profitably meet
Target new PGM customers (OEMs, Chemical companies, Pharma, Hydrogen markets, etc)
Write and present precious metals packages/proposals to customers in co-operation with traders and other internal stakeholders, such as account managers.
Ensure that all proposals contain complete financial information so that the Profit and Loss of each deal is readily visible and can be set against any possible market/credit risk a deal can give rise to.
Make certain that each proposal meets the BASF's risk/reward criteria and is in line with the business unit's objectives.
Allocate own time and travel to customers (30-50%) and projects according to priorities agreed by the Head of commercial.
Communicate with other commercial/trading counterparties within the business unit who could benefit from information gathered from the market
Work closely with traders in actually closing and quoting on precious metals deals to customers
Lease management
Communicating lease quotes, ensuring clear internal communication of customer intentions to return /roll over metal obligations
Manage account receivables with credit department
Keep customers informed for any market leasing trends to capture most value for our business
Manage Master lease agreements with customers
Trading
Develop further understanding of BASF trading business with a view to providing back up for certain front desk activities where necessary. Use information from trading team to create value for CCM business when discussing with customers/potential customers
Complying with the “4 eye internal compliance policy and ensuring that all commercial/trading activities meet our CCM compliance standards
PGM planning
Obtaining PGM forecasting from internal BASF businesses, PGM markets and from OEMs/chemical customers
Monitoring of forecasting relative to existing open forward trades
Understand global market developments and the impact they have into our PGM business
Ad hoc data mining
Review of historic credit lines, optimizing credit process
Tracking monthly sales volumes and prices
Liaising with Operations to optimise data gathering techniques
